recipe_name: Goat koftas with a yoghurt, mint and lime dressing
author: Angela Hartnett
method: Heat a small frying pan and add 1 tablespoon of oil.  Once hot add the onion and cook until soft. Place all the kofta ingredients, apart from the oil, into a bowl and mix thoroughly. Shape into sausage shapes.  Heat a heavy flat griddle pan. Oil the koftas with the remaining oil and cook on the griddle for 6-7 minutes turning around constantly so they cook evenly. Mix all the dressing ingredients in a bowl and season to taste with salt and pepper. To serve, stuff the pitta bread with the cooked koftas, dressing and cheese and enjoy warm.
ingredients: 5 tbsp olive oil,  1 small onion, finely chopped ,  300g/10½oz minced goat,  2 garlic cloves, chopped ,  handful of mint, chopped,  handful of parsley, chopped,  25g/1oz toasted pine nuts ,  1 tsp ground cinnamon,  1 tsp cumin,  pinch freshly grated nutmeg,  ½ cucumber, peeled and diced,  2 tbsp chopped fresh mint,  300g/10½oz yoghurt ,  2 limes, juice only,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  4 white pitta breads, warmed,  400g/14oz feta cheese or halloumi, broken into pieces
